climbs.name: Us and Them
climbs.fa: Bob Gaines and Mike Moretti, October 2007

content.description: Begin just right of The Brontos or Us and climb the left of two flakes, then face climb up and right, merging with The Dike at it's upper section.
content.location: Just right of The Brontos or Us

content.description: Start 10 feet left of The Brontos or Us and climb a crack that peters out into face climbing, joining The Brontos or Us at it's last  (3rd) bolt.
content.protection: For setting up a toprope, a rigging rope is handy. Gear anchor: a .5 inch CD and several 3 to 3.5 inches.
content.location: Just left of The Brontos or Us

content.description:
This fun route is left of

Bronto's or Us, The

and follows a crack up to a roof, where one makes the crux moves out and right under a roof.  From here lieback around the corner of the roof and up easy climbing on very good rock.  The protection down below is somewhat shaky, but the crux moves pro'd with small cams under the roof itself are bomber.  Long runners there.
content.protection: Pro at the top for anchor, walk over to Friendly Hands to rap the formation.
content.location: Set up underneath the largish roof on the east face of Jimmy Cliff, couple hundred feet left of Friendly Hands.

climbs.name: Penalty Runout
climbs.fa: Randy Vogel, Maria Cranor & Alan Roberts 1980

content.description: Climb a runout face to a diagonal crack/ramp that heads left. Finish up the dihedral
content.location: Left of third world/the harder they fall

climbs.name: Harder They Fall, The
climbs.fa: Alan Bartlett and Alan Roberts, Nov. 1982

content.description: loose rock, but with some nice moves on steep rock
content.location: This is on the north face of the rock, in a prominent right-facing dihedral about 100 feet to the left of Friendly Hands.  It has the same start as Third World, but goes over the roof instead of around it.

content.description:
A fun, if short, route up the east face of Jimmy Cliff. An awkward start onto a ramp leads quickly to the crux moves pulling around into and up an off-fingers crack. Delicate liebacking with careful balance will see you through two or three tricky moves to easier terrain above. Protection is easy to place before starting the hard moves, but you may be above your gear before you can get another piece in.

Fun route, it would get another star if it were longer (and closer to the road).

There are few (if any) hand jams to be had.
content.protection: Protects well with small to medium cams.  Bolted anchor with somewhat sketchy slings.

content.description: a pleasant hand crack in a shaded location
content.location: This route is on the north face of the rock.  It starts the same place as Friendly Hands, but goes sharply to the right.

content.description:
This is the obvious left-slanting dike left of

Friendly Hands

, with a low crux and runout but easier climbing above. One star out of five.
Start up the prominent dike system immediately left of Friendly Hands, and then cut right up the face that leads directly to bolt anchors atop Friendly Hands. One star out of five.
content.protection: None, but a TR works well.

content.description:
This intermittent thin crack in a sort of right facing flake system takes the line immediately to the right of

Friendly Hands

, passing a single bolt (old, not confidence inspiring) in the vicinity of the crux. While the old bolt on this route has been replaced, it is still a heads-up lead. The Vogel guide gives this 5.10b, consensus will likely settle a bit higher. Although short, the climbing is fairly continuous with a very distinct crux.
content.protection: Emphasis on thin stuff...small wires and cams, one bolt (1/2" SS). There is a two-bolt anchor/rap station (1/2" SS) on the ledge.
content.location: On the right side of the east face of Jimmy Cliff, starting in the same place as Friendly Hands and taking the thin crack/flake and face line about 5' to the right. There is a lone bolt at 2/3 height.

content.description: A very well protected steep face.  This is a good place to climb on a hot day.
content.protection: 3 bolts (1/2" SS) + a few pieces of gear
content.location: A bolted route on the north face of the rock, to the left of Friendly Hands.
